service.title: OAuth 2.0 Token Revocation
service.documentation: This document proposes an additional endpoint for OAuth authorization servers, which allows clients to notify the authorization server that a previously obtained refresh or access token is no longer needed. This allows the authorization server to clean up security credentials. A revocation request will invalidate the actual token and, if applicable, other tokens based on the same authorization grant.

oauth-token-type-hint.documentation: A hint about the type of the token submitted for revocation. access_token identifies an access token as defined in RFC 6749.
A hint about the type of the token submitted for revocation. refresh_token identifies an refresh token as defined in RFC 6749.
